 T-11.011  - Lobbying Transparency and Ethics Act 
 Section 32 Versions 
 Full text  
 Show all versions  
 Hide all versions  
 In force date 
 2002-06-13 
  Show full text at this date
 32 .   No person may, in the course of lobbying activities, disclose confidential information obtained in or in connection with the previous exercise of a public office, or advise anyone on the basis of information that is not available to the public concerning either the parliamentary, governmental or municipal institution in which the person held a public office, or a person with which the person had significant and direct relations in the year preceding the date on which the person ceased to hold a public office in that institution. 
 2002, c. 23, s. 32 .
